data.title: Great for lunch and dinner
data.text: Von and his wife cover Southern cuisine, homemade Asian cuisine, and a little fusion. Everything is fantastic. Von is an enthusiastic host, and he makes sure the service is perfect.

data.title: Excellent Food Combined With Excellent Service
data.text: Great downtown restaurant in Mobile.  Fresh food perfectly prepared.  This restaurant is a winner.  The service is top notch.  The atmosphere is great.  All of that and the prices are good.  You can't ask for more than that.

data.title: Awesome Food
data.text: The food is absolutely awesome!  The service is absolutely awesome.  This is a Top 3 restaurant for us in Mobile.  I absolutely love this place.  You cannot go wrong with anything on the menu!!!

data.title: Do not miss Vons while in Mobile
data.text:
Vons is tucked away at 69 St Michael just one block from The Battle House it's an easy walk. But that's not the exciting part! Nope. 
Von is there cooking and making sure that each meal comes to your table with love. 
Excellent service, nice atmosphere, and great food. 
Each day there is a special, if you hit lasagna day get it, I know, I know this is a Thai restaurant but really this is the best lasagna ever!
Next I can not stress enough how good the gumbo is, ekkkkkk, yes it's gumbo, but there is a reason for this madness. Von and family are from Bayou Labatre world famous for Gulf Coast Seafood, so they perfected this major dish and it is soooooooo good. 
Ok the Thai food is fantastic, no tom yum but the pad Thai and lettuce rolls are very nice. 
So do not miss this jewel.

data.title: Love Love Love this place.
data.text: What a great place for lunch. Friendly and helpful staff, incredible bread pudding! Healthy servings and delicious food!

data.title: Great dinner
data.text: We ate at Von's Bistro for the first time last night on a friend's recommendation. It is small, so call for reservation if you can.  I had Shrimp and Grits. Very good with a creole flavor, so a little spicy, but not hot.  I don't eat hot and it was fine. Way too much grits, really, but the shrimp and crawfish were excellent. Fiance had Hibachi with chicken. He cleaned his plate - said the veggies were excellent. The only downside was the noise level inside.  We were offered outside and should have taken that. Although, the outside needs a bit more light once the sun goes down.  I would go back.

data.title: amazing food
data.text:
A very close walk from our Hotel, The Battlehouse. Make sure you make reservations, or you will be out of luck. It's a bit prices, but it's worth every penny. I had the ribs which were Thai infused, best that I have ever had. It is certainly one of the hot spots to eat in downtown Mobile. Check the times that restaurants are opened, that is one thing we found was strange, lots close very early. some just close when they feel like it.
 The owner came out and introduced herself, and that to me is a class act, very nice to meet the chef, behind such great food. Well done.

data.title: Great service, good food
data.text: The ambiance of Von's is fantastic.  The food is good.  The service is great.  Give it a try.  They have wine pairings with their specials and that is a nice touch.

data.title: Delicious bread pudding!
data.text: I've been here twice. First with a couple of girlfriends for dinner and secondly with my hubby for dessert and coffee. Loved it both times! The Bahn Mi anything is fabulous...( tacos, noodle bowl, nachos...depending on the menu of the day) I do wish the Bahn Mi noodle bowl was a regular menu item. Or any noodle bowl for that matter... It's my fav! The Bread pudding with vanilla cream sauce won awards and I know why... It is so buttery and yummy! We tried the crab Au gratin dip (it was good but a bit too salty for me. Won't do that one again) Also, we got coffee with Bailey's in it which was amazing but with the Price tag on that one... probably won't do that again. Lesson learned... Also, the bolognese pasta bowl (Vietnamese? Nah) was just not what I was wanting...too meaty, greasy. But the menfolk seem to like that sort of thing... 😏

data.title: Awesome Dinner
data.text: 5 stars all around service and food were top notch. Surf and turf chef special and Parmesan crusted grouper special were to die for. Add in the bread pudding and that was one of the best meals I have had anywhere in a long time. We will be back and look forward to trying their Saturday brunch!!!!

data.title: Great menu
data.text: I love Von's because the menu is so cool. The meatloaf will blow your mind and if your order any of the Asian fusion dishes you can't go wrong. You'll never leave hungry!

data.title: Innovative menu
data.text:
OK, I've only eaten here once but once is enough to prove to me that this is an awesome restaurant.  I sat at the bar so I was able to watch the cooks prepare meals before me. I only wish I could've stayed a couple of more hours to enjoy some of the dishes I saw being prepared.

My fish taco was absolutely delicious. Crisp cabbage and the properly cooked fish along with a Cajun sauce and pico de gallo low added a little spice to create a delicious concoction.

data.title: A Hidden Gem
data.text: I had read an article about this place back in May. It was incorrectly placed on Dauphin Street, but I found it and was not disappointed. I dined in the evening with my daughter. Everything we saw passing on to other tables was beautiful and looked so good. Our selections were very pleasing (seafood nachos and fish tacos). The Chef came out among the guests and all staff were very friendly and attentive. I really recommend this and look forward to trying some of their other fare.

data.title: Perfect date spot
data.text: We absolutely loved Von's Bistro. The server was very informative and friendly, and the food was delicious. They also have a great craft beer selection. I highly recommend trying this restaurant out.

data.title: Looking for lunch?
data.text:
Von's is home cooking on many levels.  You have a taste of Thai and then a daily special. If you go on Lasagna day get it, the best!
Look at their chefs special of the day cause they really are special. The word special has been used a lot but trust me it's because this is a special place. 
If you are in a hurry be there at 11:00 am sharpe and you will be served quickly but from 11:15 to 12:30 it stays busy and it will take your lunch hour. 
Friendly service tops off a great meal at an affordable price.

data.title: A MUST try
data.text: We had been meaning to try Von's as we had good things hit never thought far enough ahead to make reservations. We finally did it. It is a small but quaint bistro on a side street in busy downtown Mobile. We were seated promptly at our designated time and places our drink orders. The server explained the special menu is only around for a week and once it's gone...that's it. Anything on their regular menu is great too but you can get it anytime so she suggested the specials. They serve a Southern Korean blend of you can imagine but I tell you it works. We ordered the Korean Meatloaf topped with crisp pork belly served with Asian veggies and fried rice with an Asian glaze and the Redfish topped with a shrimp and crawfish creole sauce over a gulf crab dressing. I tell you that I've been on a strict portion control diet for months and intended to split it and take half home for the next day. I blew that. If I would have had a heal of bread, I would have stopped every last drop...and almost did. The meatloaf was equally was yummy bathe fried rice as a little different but wonderful taste. I think it was the fresh ginger that is grown by Vons mother in her greenhouse. They also have bread pudding and banana pudding and cheesecake and other homemade desserts. We were stuffed so we did not attempt one this trip.  They use many locally and homegrown veggies and seasonings. We were promptly greeted by the owner, Paul Larson, who gave us the rundown on the business. They started in the bayou and still own a food truck. His wife, Von, is the head chef and they collaborate on ideas for specials each week and offer an Asian dish, a pasta dish, a seafood dish and a fresh cut steak. Later in the meal, Von came over and spoke to us. None of it was scripted and just a "how did you enjoy it" dialogue that you get but they were very genuine and we felt like we were regulars and had known them forever during our first ever visit. We hope to make it one of our regular stops in downtown Mobile. They are also open for lunch but our schedules do not put us on the area during the day. If I could give Vons Bistro more than 5 stars, I most certainly would. First class!!

data.title: Delish!
data.text: Visiting family and they took us here for lunch. Beautiful day so we sat outside. Perfect!  Service was great. Our server knew everything about every dish. I got the chicken fried rice. I could tell it was made to order. Very fresh. Hubby got the special. Korean bbq pork bowl. He loved it.  You should find this place if you are in Mobile.

data.title: Von-tastic!!!
data.text: Second time eating lunch here - sat outside and enjoyed the weather.  Curried shrimp tacos were the Chef's special and average according to the 19-year-old, who would've liked a little more spice.  My Bahn Mi (pork belly) tacos were AMAZING, as were the Hog tacos (BBQ).  Hibachi Grill Asian dish was also very flavorful.  The sweet-n-sour sauce with those and the sauce on the tacos was crazy good.  Also the best bread pudding with vanilla cream sauce I've ever had, and a special green tea crème brulee - don't leave without dessert!   Friendly service and nice street with palm trees lining it - worth walking the extra block past the Battle House for the food!

data.title: One of downtowns best!
data.text: This is one of the best places in the up and coming downtown resurgence.  Excellent service with fresh ingredients and dynamite Asian flair. Have returned to consistent visits. Always with a crowd and  very friendly staff.

data.title: Southern/Asian Cuisine
data.text: I had lunch with my best friend and had the spring rolls and the Thai rice noodles with chicken. It was good, but it could have used a little more asian flair in the seasonings.  If you plan to eat there, make reservations.  Service was good, and they have extensive wine list and cocktail list.  Plan to return to try dinner and drinks.
